characters.birthday: The first suit of armor was forged in the dead of winter, many centuries ago.

stories.title: Background
stories.text:
'What truly defines a person - their physical form, or their soul?'

As an embodiment of honor and principle within this ancient family, time has not left him with the scars of decay, but with a haunting question of existence. The true cause of his loss of physical form centuries ago remains unknown, yet his obsession with the 'silver-haired, crimson-eyed Bloodborn' is unrelenting.

stories.title: Defeated by Time
stories.text:
They say Baphomet was not always as we know him now. Few recall the knight who once raised the banner of Holy War for his family, nor the day he sealed himself within a tower where light could never reach, lost to countless forbidden experiments. He could not—would not—lay down his hammer. He swore to reclaim the 'life' devoured by regret and hatred.

When the fires of the last battle faded, armor lay scattered, and all deeds and misdeeds crumbled to dust. In the end, the flame of a soul proved fragile—snuffed out by the whisper of the night wind.

stories.title: Defeated by Kin
stories.text:
They say Baphomet once wore indestructible armor, forged by the former head of his family. Yet none could have foreseen it would be shattered by his own blood. His daughter, born under a curse, was prophesied to end him. Against all odds, the hardened old knight softened, raising her in the dungeon, believing he could seal the curse by sealing away the skylight.

That was until that night, when the girl drove her blade through his breastplate. Since then, he has changed his armor often—but mortal steel cannot withstand the rust of years, and his heart has aged with it.

stories.title: Ship in a Bottle
stories.text:
An ancient wooden ship model, its rotting timbers endlessly replaced to preserve its original form. Carved into the base are the words:
'What truly defines a person—their physical form, or their soul?' Did the one who asked ever find their answer?

stories.title: Defeated by Fate
stories.text:
Baphomet's death remains a controversy within the ancient castle. But perhaps only we two know the truth: what defeated him was neither me—the obvious enemy—nor age, that predictable rival, but the nemesis he scorned most—destiny.

Centuries ago, he fell before me, body broken, but his will clinging to his armor as a vessel of life. Centuries later, my blade once more shattered that armor, and with it, his soul was lost.

The shackles of destiny were inescapable. Yet to fall for his family's honor, in a final duel with his sworn foe—though regrets may linger, his life knew no shame.

characters.name: Clive
characters.title: Blade of Ganelon
characters.birthday: Born amidst a tempest.

stories.title: Background
stories.text:
'Every time I open my eyes, it marks the beginning of a tragedy. But this time... I have you by my side.'

The father of Clive Jr. and Hati, the current Gravekeeper of the Ganelon family. Centuries of warfare have driven its people north, but Clive's direct bloodline remains in Lupine Forest, bearing the burden of the Gravekeeper's duty.

Clive lives his entire life bound by inescapable duty, by inescapable fate—yet he chooses to stay. He never complains, never yields, until that destined one finally arrives.

stories.title: A Trusted Friend
stories.text:
I've heard much about the profound bond between Clive and Gadric. But only after seeing the full shape of their story did I realize—that what they shared was more than mere friendship; it was something far more intricate.

This explains Clive's extraordinary trust in Gadric. And Gadric never once betrayed that trust—even after Clive transformed into a beast.

stories.title: Failed Family
stories.text:
Those who knew them could never understand why Clive treated his two children so differently. Though the adopted son Clive Jr. bore a striking resemblance to him, Clive kept his distance from this mirror image. They barely exchanged words—yet his demeanor held no aversion, only detachment.

It was only after I uncovered the truth that I understood: the detachment was a mask for guilt... guilt over his own younger self.

stories.title: Unforgotten Promise
stories.text:
I'm grateful that I still remembered to keep my promise to Clive—even though I had 'forgotten,' and the promise was only fulfilled on Clive's final day.

I managed to meet him before he was fully corrupted by the Black Blood. Just as the story had played out before, the cycle repeated, leading everything to its end.

He had carried such a heavy burden, and still, he pressed on. The one who once saw me as a hero... proved to be the true hero.

stories.title: Pillow
stories.text: A pillow Hati stitched for Clive—silent witness to many sleepless nights clouded with doubt. In one corner bloomed a small Wolfsbane, a quiet vow woven in thread. Over time, the bloom faded, foreshadowing a parting they could never escape.

characters.name: Clive Jr.
characters.title: Future Gravekeeper
characters.birthday: Born amidst a tempest.

stories.title: Background
stories.text:
'Can you take me with you the next time you leave? I promise I'll be useful.'

He always stood behind his father, gazing at the village nestled among the woods where he was born and raised.

He was young, yet determined. He dreamed of the day he would inherit the Moonlight Sword and become a worthy Gravekeeper.

But by the time he gained the strength to bear that duty, he was a lone wolf.

stories.title: False Happiness
stories.text:
It was a rainy night, the Lupine Forest drenched in a downpour unseen for decades. Clive Jr. was born into such an unsettling night, where conspiracy and chaos shattered the happy, complete family he might have had.

The roar of thunder drowned out his feeble cries. But by some fortune, he met Clive. Clive Jr. once told me that, though the memory was faint, he still recalled an embrace—one that reeked of blood, cold and hard, much like the role Clive would play in his life for many years to come.

stories.title: The Absent Father
stories.text:
Compared to his foster father, Uncle Gadric, Clive's close friend, was more like a real father to Clive Jr. He would often climb onto Gadric's shoulders and gaze across the Lupine Forest together, hearing about Uncle Gadric's adventures. In these tales, he could imagine himself just being as free and brave.

There’s another secret, known only to those involved, and myself. When Clive Jr. was still young enough to speak without fear, he once asked Gadric if he could take him away. Whether Gadric sensed the unease and resentment hidden behind those words, he only patted the boy's head in silent comfort.

stories.title: The Real Mother
stories.text:
Clive was always absent, and Hati took on the role of parent. If Gadric was the father figure in this family, then Hati was the real mother, with Clive Jr. always affectionately by her side.

Hati's talent for sewing developed while raising Clive Jr. After all, in a household of a distant father and a willful child, someone had to be the glue holding things together. Yet even with all Hati's efforts, there remained an unmistakable distance between Clive and Clive Jr.

stories.title: Moonlight Dagger
stories.text:
The dagger that gleamed under the silver moon was proof of direct descent from the Ganelon family. It would grow stronger as Clive Jr. grew, and vanish when his life came to an end. It was also his only solace—that he shared a deeper bond with his foster father than his sister ever did.

He dreamed of the day his dagger would become a great sword. But when that day finally came, he understood the look in Clive's eyes—a gaze filled with pity, mourning the youth forever trapped in this endless cycle...

characters.name: Goldland
characters.title: Captain of the El Dorado
characters.birthday: During a certain autumn festival held by the family.

stories.title: Background
stories.text:
'I will guide them in the only right direction.' As both Captain and patriarch of the El Dorado, Goldland carries himself with an air of superiority—after all, the right direction is always within his telescope's view. Yet, despite his elegant manners and proper discourse, his words betray an unmistakable narcissism and pride.

However, Goldland seems deeper than his obvious shallowness. Does he ever look back with regrets at those choices, right and wrong? And those moments of weakness, which he couldn't reveal, did they weigh on him through sleepless nights?

Carrying everyone's lives on his shoulders, can he still press on? Will the dawn come after the bitter night?

stories.title: Sailor's Diary
stories.text: The well-preserved ship's log chronicles every day of sailing since the El Dorado first set sail. Whether major events or minor occurrences, as long as it happened aboard the ship, Goldland recorded it all... or did he?

stories.title: El Dorado Sets Sail
stories.text:
April 3rd, 1337. Clear. I, Kristoph Goldland, captain of the greatest ship in history—the El Dorado—am set to embark on her maiden voyage on this momentous day! One can scarcely imagine the splendor of the inaugural ceremony, but it was all worth it. This merchant vessel shall amass great wealth anew, and our first destination will be—the domain of the Landis! This affluent family will bring us our first great fortune.

—Excerpt from the Captain's Log of the El Dorado

stories.title: A Glimmer of Hope
stories.text:
February 3rd, 1339. Weather... Who knows—I've been trapped in my cabin, tormented by that little monster. It's all because Ami's nurse fell ill, leaving me with this monumental mess. The destructive power of a child this age is truly terrifying. For some reason, she's been crying all night, every night. Heavens, pray for that nurse's swift recovery. I'm nearing my wits' end. And William has sneaked away again, right when it's his turn to take over. Good grief!

But, I must admit, when she quiets down on the rare occasion, she resembles a little angel. As expected of the pure Landis bloodline. I hope she grows up well...

—Excerpt from the Captain's Log of the El Dorado

stories.title: The Final Chapter
stories.text:
October 7th, 1354. Clear, perfect sunshine. Yet the air aboard feels heavier with each passing day. William—the root of it all—has turned into someone I scarcely recognize. He is no longer the person I once knew. Left with no other options, I've contacted Cain. I don't know if his solution will work, but I've no choice now but to try. I won't let William drag the whole crew under.

I pray the fabled Sunset Isle will truly hold the answers we seek. Let it not be the end of our voyage.

—The final entry in the Captain's Log of the El Dorado

characters.name: Limine
characters.title: Scarlet Matriarch
characters.birthday: Unknown.

characters.name: Stella
characters.title: Starbound Voyager
characters.birthday: The day flames devoured everything.

stories.title: Background
stories.text:
'Let the Other Side know salvation.'

Countless alchemical constructs surged forth, their steel claws and fangs tearing asunder the shimmering stars of her homeland.

Mist veiled the sun. The constructs fouled the water, and all things withered into ruin.

A girl who bore the name Noah took a vow: even if she must stand alone—even if she must pursue them across realms—she would never cease her hunt.

Her vow, her war, unyielding and eternal.

stories.title: The Newborn Cub
stories.text:
After that less-than-successful attempt at written conversation, Stella never reached out to me again. I still saw her often around the castle—like a newborn cub, she regarded this strange world with equal parts curiosity and caution. I tried to approach her, but whenever our eyes met, she would pause for a heartbeat… then quickly turn and leave.

I asked Regina about it. She told me that in a few days, the home-leave granted by Captain Ami would end. After that, they would return to their own world, board the El Dorado, and set off on a new adventure.

…Perhaps I should be the one to seek her out.

stories.title: A World That Might Have Been
stories.text:
Stella wished to learn this world's history. But my time since waking had been brief, and I knew little more than she did. So we arranged to meet in the library.

As she stepped into the room—lined with parchment scrolls and timeworn tomes—her face lit up with wonder. In her world, under the Mastermind's orders, constructs had destroyed nearly all written works to obstruct and monopolize the spread of knowledge.

What little remained—knowledge that fueled the fight for freedom—was preserved only in hushed whispers passed between those who dared resist.

I had never truly understood how precious books could be.

stories.title: A Quiet Reunion
stories.text:
After learning Stella's wish, I extended an invitation to Aiona and the rest.

They accepted without hesitation, and we agreed to meet at the dining hall.

Perhaps it was disbelief—or the quiet fear that often comes with returning home—but the radiant joy Stella had shown upon first meeting Asta was nowhere to be seen. She appeared reserved, even a little shy.

Thankfully, Empousa and Hati were there to soften the silence. With warm smiles, they took her hands in theirs and gently coaxed out the emotions she'd kept hidden.

At last, her guarded walls gave way. Aiona pulled her into a quiet embrace, letting her tears fall freely onto flowing robes.

I rose without a word and stepped to the dining hall's entrance—keeping watch to ensure this long-awaited reunion would remain undisturbed.

Let this beautiful moment belong to her, and her alone.

stories.title: Tiny Construct
stories.text:
A parting gift from Stella to Noah before her departure.

These alchemical war machines once pushed the world to the brink of destruction under the Mastermind's control.

But this little construct has been tenderly disarmed—its power core removed, its frame reduced to a harmless size.

No longer a weapon, it now serves a far gentler role: not as a tool of war, but as a companion.

characters.name: Piera
characters.title: Keeper of Yore
characters.birthday: The Kalends of October, when storm clouds shrouded the sky.

stories.title: Background
stories.text:
'Accept your end peacefully, for that is the destination of all.'

On Sunset Isle, her longing had once taken form as a phantom—yet even that proved nothing more than a fleeting dream. Despite the weight of her regrets, Regina shut her eyes and surrendered to the fate that awaited her.

But then, radiant sunlight touched her skin once more.

What realm is this? By whom was she called back from the void?

Perhaps her story was never meant to end on that distant shore?

stories.title: Past Phantoms
stories.text:
Seeing Piera again left me breathless. I had believed her lost forever to the Sunset Isle—that our last farewell would truly be final. Yet here she stands before me. Who has given her form this time?

Though I understand nothing of how it came to pass, Piera radiates a joy I never dared imagine possible.

For her, every moment beyond Sunset Isle is a gift stolen from time itself.

But now that her mission has ended, perhaps I should call her by her true name.

Regina.

stories.title: Hollow Present
stories.text:
The place that never saw sunset has been claimed by the sea, and yet the darkness that once imprisoned this isle now glows before me, vibrant and alive.

If this resurrection has nothing to do with her longing, then how did she reclaim life itself?

Regina once spoke of her past with Albrecht—colleagues bound by their knowledge of Alchemy's deepest mysteries.

Blood carries memory in its crimson depths. Perhaps Albrecht drew upon Regina's essence to grant her new life within The Exodus.

I wrote seeking answers, but his reply was simply a blank parchment and silence.

stories.title: Radiant Future
stories.text:
Last night, Regina confided that her leave was drawing to a close. Soon she would return to the Other Side, rejoining the El Dorado for a new journey across uncharted waters.

I asked if she wished to see Piera before departing.

She considered this for a long moment, then gently declined.

Her love for Piera runs deeper than oceans. It is precisely because of this love that she refuses to subject Piera to another painful farewell—not when she has finally stepped free from the shadows of yesterday.

In truth, they both deserve their own luminous futures.

Before taking leave, she promised to bring me something special upon next reunion.

stories.title: Construct Heart
stories.text:
Regina carried back a construct heart from The Exodus.

She tells me it is an old custom.

That when split in two, a construct's heart becomes twin talismans, each half carrying a blessing of protection for those who matter most.

characters.name: Albrecht
characters.title: Crystal Sage
characters.birthday: The day when torrential floods descended from the heavens.

stories.title: Background
stories.text:
'When one's knowledge and memory cease to exist, that is when true death occurs.'

On the title page of the Church's 'Codex Sanctus,' the second name blessed by the Saint blazes with ethereal radiance—Albrecht Magnus, enigmatic Bell Ringer No. III, and history's first mortal soul to grasp the mysteries of alchemy.

His presence has woven itself into the very sinews of time. When scholars fold yellowed parchment, when smiths forge molten steel, when soldiers hone their blades—in countless unconscious moments, the embers of his legacy smolder in silence. Humanity calls this presence the 'Gift of Magnus,' speaking of it as naturally as wind through leaves or seeds sleeping in fertile earth.

In the light cast through the skylight of an alchemist's workshop, one can still faintly make out the presence of this Bell Ringer, bent over his sacred work, wielding civilization as his compass. What seethes within his crucible is neither mercury nor sulfur, but something far more profound—pure thought.

'From where does this world rise, and to where are we headed?'

stories.title: Cursed Birth
stories.text:
I feel life hemorrhaging from my flesh, and thought crystallizing within my skull.

This body feels like a god-given cage for my disobedience—lungs that cannot draw breath, legs that cannot bear weight, a tongue that cannot form words... Like some primordial curse, this torment devours my soul with each passing day. They speak of an unknown 'disease,' seared into my marrow from my very first breath.

My future stretches before me like a funeral shroud, yet I know that within death's maw, I can still seize that 'answer' which will grant me deliverance.

stories.title: Pleading for Life
stories.text:
My hunger for life compels me to drag this shattered frame forward, endlessly seeking herbs that might break my curse. My defiance of death forces these weary eyes to remain vigilant, endlessly battling the poison that seeps through my consciousness.

They all believe this dying child has surrendered his sanity to madness. But I can no longer spare thought for their stares and whispers—this disease wages war against the soul that is rightfully mine.

I feel the exquisite agony of ripped sinew, I taste the invisible hands, suffocating my throat... The hourglass empties. Time bleeds.

But yield I will not.

stories.title: Truth in the Tempest
stories.text:
It rained.

This was the first torrential downpour I had witnessed since my earliest memories. Clutching my disease-ridden shell, I sheltered inside the cave, watching the relentless deluge scour the earth clean. A bitter resentment gnawed at me—my life ebbed away with each passing moment, yet here I cowered, hiding from nature's fury.

When the tempest finally abated and I emerged unto the rain-soaked earth, a verdant flash stopped my heart: the tree trunk that should have withered to rot had somehow birthed fresh buds from its dying flesh...

—Resurrection. The answer I had sought lay hidden within that very storm. Or perhaps... within each seemingly insignificant droplet that fell from the weeping sky.

stories.title: Deep Reflections
stories.text:
I heard the water breathing—a resonance more profound than life itself. They enveloped me from all quarters, mingling with the crimson tide in my veins, drawing me toward an unfathomable depth.

I witnessed water's true form—configurations with weight greater than whole worlds. They crystallized before my eyes, filling the hollow spaces within my flesh, guiding me toward a distant place.

As if stirring from some fevered dream, I found myself standing once more in that chamber lined with bottles and phials, the air thick with unspeakable fragrances—the place that was once my sanctuary, and now my laboratory of metamorphosis:

Let the experiments begin...

characters.name: Timeless Aiona
characters.title: The Cosmic Wrinkle
characters.birthday: The Ides of April, when green grass grows.

stories.title: Background
stories.text:
<style=Highlight>We recommend experiencing the [Ashes of Time] story before reading this Vassal Journal.</style>

'Thousands of years, gone in the blink of an eye.'

Her hood and veil cloaked her visage; none would know her true identity. Perhaps even she has forgotten.

Should one defy destiny, or follow the path of fate?

For the one true future, within the annihilating void, a Vassal whom none remember endures her endless, futile vigil.

stories.title: Sands of Time
stories.text:
Through the fractured sea of time, Aiona drifted between the tides of past and future. Once, I asked how many cycles she had endured. She only shook her head in silence. Perhaps even she no longer remembers.

At last, she seized that single wave. She succeeded though the cost was trauma etched deep by countless, agonizing returns.

Along that endless journey, she left so much behind. Companions. Family. Feelings. All she carried was her obsession to break the cycle.

Even now, she remains ever watchful, as though still wandering that sunless desert.

I sent her an hourglass, hoping she would understand that no hand will come to turn it again. Be it time, or the sands within, everything has finally come to rest.

stories.title: Instruments of Time
stories.text:
From her most recent letter, Aiona's mood seems lighter. Her memories now hold clearer glimpses of her companions, no longer is she swallowed by the void. And yet, the sorrow of countless farewells still lingers. I find myself quietly troubled.

But just last night, I saw her in the castle greenhouse, tending to the Wolfsbane with Empousa and Hati at her side.

I had underestimated her. She has reclaimed what she once cast away. The shadows of yesterday can no longer slow her steps toward tomorrow.

Trusting she will not be burdened by her family's past, I placed the ceremonial relic of the Alitas within her chamber.

stories.title: The Woolen Lamb
stories.text:
Bella unveiled a new collection of wares, her puppet chattering away as it hawked gaudy trinkets at absurd prices.

Amid the clutter, I noticed a woolen toy. Its coat heavy with dust, its seams frayed by time.

It stirred a memory. A little lamb we encountered during my first meeting with Aiona.

I cleaned and mended the lamb with care, then placed the small companion in the hands of the Alita heir.

She held it in silence. Yet in that moment, I saw something I had never seen before—Aiona's lips, curved in the faintest smile.

'Noah, I want to go home.'

stories.title: Almond Milk
stories.text:
A delicacy from Aiona's ancestral homeland.

Though the Alita family has long faded into the mists of time, this delicacy from their land endures.

Rich in nourishment, silken on the tongue, and sweet with the deep essence of nuts.

Street vendors like to boast: the almond milk sold each year could circle the entire continent.

characters.name: Quinn
characters.title: Blackbird's Song
characters.birthday: The first battle between the Bathory and the Ganelon.

stories.title: Background
stories.text:
'I could have endured the endless night, had I never seen the blazing sun.'

All the world knows the Howling Peninsula as a forsaken realm, cast beyond daylight's reach.

She was born under that darkness, like the rest of her kin. She could've lived her life beneath the moon, untouched by light or hope. But then she read a book—foreign poetry, written by sunlit people. The verses glowed with a quiet longing, and something inside her shifted. She began to write. In secret. Songs of light. Dreams of warmth.

When those songs crossed six centuries to reach the future, her doubts were finally answered. That single reply felt like light piercing through the dark. Persecution. Flames of war. Betrayal... The Howling Peninsula's shadow runs deeper than its endless night. She resolved to shatter this prison of perpetual darkness and claim a dawn of her own.

stories.title: Beneath the Forbidden Sun
stories.text:
What was it Quinn had said? A way to walk in sunlight?

The last time I felt the sun on my skin, I needed Sapphire Isle's alchemical shield just to survive it.

Though the Bloodborn were granted eternity, the light cast us out. The sun turned us into ghosts on our own land.

For me, maybe it doesn't matter anymore. But to many of our kind, sunlight is the one thing they still long for.

Quinn knew that. And that's what makes her promise so dangerous.

stories.title: The Traitor
stories.text:
Through the name 'Quinn,' I swiftly traced a young woman in the family records—one who walked these halls three centuries past: Quinn Baphomet.

Curiously, her name was scratched out. No connections to the bloodline. Just a warning scrawled beside it in red: Traitor. Condemned for kinslaying and betraying the clan. A final decree remained: should her whereabouts surface, capture and execute without mercy.

A killer of her own blood. No wonder she never dared set foot near the castle.

Yet here she lurks, watching from the shadows with patient eyes...

But if she wants to approach the castle, I can use that to my advantage. Lure her in. Flush her out.

stories.title: The Mysterious Woman
stories.text: As promised, I arrived at the castle's side entrance when midnight's bell tolled. Naturally, I had not come alone as agreed—my guards crouched hidden in shadow's embrace, awaiting their moment to strike. As night deepened its hold, I kept vigil upon the weathered stone steps. The moon sank behind twisted branches, yet she remained absent. Weariness crept through my bones until dreams claimed me. In that dream, a young woman with pale crimson hair approached through the mist. I jolted awake, scanning the emptiness around me—finding only night's breath stirring, carrying the haunting fragrance of Wolfsbane. Had Quinn been here? My hand moved instinctively to my pocket, fingers discovering an unfamiliar slip of paper. Unfolding it, I saw neat, elegant handwriting: Bat shadows gather thick, companions to the ghostly night The moon's child gazes longingly from this shore The voyage through the stars stretches on, the promised land still distant Don't linger in dreams—go, seek the far shore of the soul This was the verse Quinn had pledged to bestow upon me. She had indeed come—slipping past while I lay vulnerable in slumber. Fearing she might have infiltrated the castle, I rushed back to investigate. Strangely, every chamber remained undisturbed.

stories.title: Quinn's Parasol
stories.text:
Exile from the light is the Bloodborn's immutable fate.
Yet Quinn refused to bow before destiny's decree. She had devoured too many hymns to daylight within forbidden poetry—yearning burned within her to walk beneath the sun as mortals do. Thus she sought Cain the steward's aid to forge this parasol of protection. Tragically, during that bitter conflict with her father, the parasol was lost within the castle's depths. For centuries it lay forgotten, never fulfilling its purpose, until...

characters.name: Agnes
characters.title: Apprentice Cartographer
characters.birthday: The day of the Cartographer's Association's 2000th anniversary.

stories.title: Background
stories.text:
'Tell me, in places yet untouched by cartographers, could greater fascinations await?'

From sketching castles and chapels to exploring culture and geography, cartographers wield charcoal and parchment to map every realm, measuring the land one step at a time. The girl had traveled countless paths alongside her cartographer grandfather, learning that staying grounded was the true calling of their craft.

Yet why, when faced with magnificent castles, did her mind wander not to blueprints and stonework, but to the graceful figures who once danced through the grand halls? And when confronted with desolate ruins, why did her mind linger not on timelines or treaties, but on the nameless souls buried beneath, erased from memory? Was a cartographer meant to be tethered only to what could be seen and measured? Did the stories she uncovered—the whispered legends, the forbidden secrets, the hidden tales—truly count for nothing?

The girl steeled herself for distant shores. Perhaps history need not follow a set course, and perhaps within time's relentless currents the unexpected truly awaits discovery. This time, she would complete her pilgrimage on her own terms.

stories.title: One Step Ahead
stories.text:
The young cartographer's scheduled survey is set for tomorrow.

Yet I can already picture it—knowing her stubborn spirit, even if the castle gates were firmly locked, she would find a way to climb in through the windows.

After careful consideration, there is only one way to prevent her entry—I must complete the survey myself, before she gets the chance.

Determined to walk the cartographer's path before she could, I made my first stop at the back garden of the castle.

This place had long since been transformed into an alchemical garden by that enigmatic steward.

As I stepped inside, the subtle smile gracing Cain's lips whispered of something out of the ordinary.

Agnes, that young girl, had already arrived and completed her initial survey.

The survey was set for tomorrow, but she'd already made her move. 

Fortunately, the first survey location was Cain's territory. Well-versed in the art of concealment, he should be able to leave no trace.

But if the survey goes any deeper, Bathory's well-hidden secrets may be laid bare. I must stop her before that happens.

stories.title: The Strange Survey Task
stories.text:
Soon three packages arrived from Agnes, delivered with the same breathless urgency that defines her nature.

Package One: Several sketches with chaotic handwriting yet remarkable spatial intuition.
<style=Highlight>Undoubtedly Agnes's handiwork, sent as cartographic reference material.</style>Package Two: A survey manual marking locations such as the Underground Sepulcher, where blood servants gather; the Ancestral Vault, where primordial Bloodborn lie in slumber; and the Alchemical Tower, where copies are forged.
<style=Highlight>Why is it that all these places are so eerie and ominous?</style>

Package Three: A parcel marked 'cartographic instruments.' Upon opening, it contained nothing but a stack of well-worn storybooks.
<style=Highlight>Surely the wrong package?</style>

Despite the ominous survey locations and the lack of proper tools, I relied on Agnes's drawings to complete the mapping task. With that, the survey should reach its conclusion.

stories.title: Time-Limited Survey
stories.text:
Elfriede is a village concealed deep within the forest's embrace.

It had been so long since I last roamed these lands that I failed to realize the territory was under nightly assault by bat swarms, leaving the villagers stricken with fear.

Clearly, these creatures were blood servants kept by the Vassals out in the wild. Since the arrival of winter forced most beasts into hibernation, the ravenous servants redirected their hunger toward this defenseless village.

Though time was pressing on the survey, saving lives took precedence. I used what remained of my medical knowledge to tend to the wounded. Once their conditions stabilized, I made my way back. Along the way, I recalled each wandering blood servant, escorting them back to the castle to return to the Vassal, accompanied by a cartload of Pure Blood Essence to soothe their terrible thirst.

Once the crisis passed, I let out a deep sigh of relief. However, an entire day had elapsed, causing the time-sensitive survey task to be marked as failed.

Just as I lifted my pen to write Agnes a letter explaining the circumstances, a sudden wave of bewilderment stirred within my heart. As those blood servants fluttered toward me, I distinctly heard a girl's piercing scream—a voice that carried something deeply unsettling.

stories.title: Agnes's Drafting Ruler
stories.text:
The drafting ruler Agnes gifted me is said to be a meticulously crafted replica of hers.

It is said that every cartographer possesses a custom-made drafting tool designed exclusively for them. This ruler is no exception—serving as both precision instrument in the girl's capable hands and dependable weapon upon the battlefield.

In its extended form, it serves for measurement and drafting work. When adjusted to a specific angle, it can be thrown like a boomerang for ranged attacks. In close combat, it can be swiftly disassembled and reassembled into a spear. A single tool with many uses—ingeniously and elegantly designed.

characters.name: Lorelei
characters.title: The Callous Sage
characters.birthday: The day when Tidewisps begin to bloom.

stories.title: Background
stories.text:
We are children who belong nowhere. So home is wherever our family is.'

Eleven years ago, a shipwreck left a drifting branch of the Landis family stranded on Sapphire Isle. There, Lorelei found a new home. She learned to live as humans do, to speak as they speak—believing those simple days might last forever.

Until the Black Blood swept across the Isle. Until a Bell Ringer reduced her second home to ash. Until the ones she once called family became the very Lords who caged her kin. She found herself caught between the two.

Humans had once given her warmth… and bound her with sin.

The land had offered her shelter… and became the grave where she buried her soul.

stories.title: Broken Siren's Tear
stories.text: The dream of turning Sapphire Isle into a land of joy has fractured. Lorelei bid her final farewell to this world, leaving behind nothing but a tainted name and a broken Siren's Tear. In the Sage's office, her personal belongings had been completely cleared away. I saw how she had spent a fortune in the auction house, we exchanged thoughts about the Mistbound Terror, and we hatched our last plan together. Yet that brilliant woman vanished without a trace, as if she too had been nothing more than an illusion woven by the devices on Sapphire Isle.

stories.title: Siren's Song
stories.text:
The broken Siren's Tear lay on the table, its luster dulled by the passage of time. From deep within, it stirred a whisper of song.

A young girl stood at the weathered bow of a ship, softly humming to the moon.

By the time she was born, the Pillars of Hercules had long since vanished beneath the waves. Her people had become wanderers, adrift on the sea. Her mother had told her, that they were like fish, and the currents chose their path.

She had not yet learned to turn her tentacles into legs, nor to speak the language of humans. But her song carried a quiet yearning—what lay beyond the waters, on those distant, unknown shores?

stories.title: Letter from Afar
stories.text:
For a long time after, no song came from the Siren's Tear. Then one day, I accidentally spilled wine on it—the pooled surface shimmered with a vision:

A maiden held a letter from the north, pressed close to her heart.

It spoke of the biting chill of those distant lands, so unlike the warm summers of Sapphire Isle; Of dry mornings with wind carrying grains of sand; Of being well—her moments of awakening growing longer.

She had read the letter countless times, clinging to it through long days of captivity and pain, holding fast to the hope of reunion.

stories.title: Mysterious Letter
stories.text:
The vision vanished without warning. In desperation, I drenched the Siren's Tear in every kind of liquor I had—At last, another glimpse.

Behind the prison bars, a masked guard slipped the maiden an envelope, saying: 'From the Mysterious Merchant.'

Could it be from her friend? Could that all-purpose Merchant truly deliver letters even into the depths of Hallon's prison?

For a moment, hope bloomed in her chest—

No. It was a command from the Master. A cruel snare, meant to make her a puppet. To force a choice between betraying her family or her friends. Throw it away. Tear it up.

But I could only stand outside the Siren's Tear, watching helplessly as it all unfolded.

stories.title: The New Sage
stories.text:
The Siren's Tear no longer responded to wine. I tried again and again, desperate to glimpse more of her hidden past.

Until one day, a drop of blood from my wounded hand spilled across its surface. And suddenly, I was pulled back to the old Sapphire Isle.

It was opening day at the auction house. Renowned merchants scoffed at the rules. Nobles turned up their noses and left. Only thugs remained, hungry for easy spoils.

Some smashed coral from the sea, then demanded 'compensation.' The young auctioneer stood trembling, encircled and helpless.

From behind the curtain, a red-haired woman stepped out with quiet grace. 'Leave the poor girl be. Perhaps I can offer compensation instead?'

Her face was entrancing, and her eyes flamed.

A ruffian sneered, lifted his sword to toy with her hair—but before anyone could blink, the man's hand had hit the floor. She stood there, faster than sight, calm and lethal.

'Who the [beep] are you?' the ruffian roared.

'Lorelei,' she replied. 'Acting manager of the Sapphire Isle auction house.' Blood spattered across her cheek—bright as her fiery hair. I reached out, trying to wipe it away, though I could only watch. 

And just for a second… it felt like she looked right at me.

stories.title: Slayer of Sirens
stories.text:
At night, I dreamed I was once again aboard the great ship of Sapphire Isle.

Constantine wiped the blood from his blade, turning to her with practiced calm. 'These test subjects are no longer of use. Dispose of them.'

'You know best how to silence them... without those dreadful screams.'

The dying sirens glared at the woman, their fins rising stiff and sharp. Their cries pierced the air, shrill with fury.

Even without understanding their language, one could sense the hatred, the betrayal from the once-kin.

She gave no reply. One by one, she moved behind each captive, sliding her blade into the base of the skull—severing the spine, then angling upward to destroy the point where body and soul met.

Each siren fell silent as blood burst forth, consciousness vanishing in an instant. Their curses died mid-breath.

Siren blood ran darker than a human's, and it streaked across her cheek like a wound carved by guilt.

I offered her a handkerchief. She took it—but did not use it. 

'Why trouble yourself, little one?' she asked. 

'This blood carries sins long etched into my soul, a mark I can never wash away.'

stories.title: Letters
stories.text:
Several letters addressed to Sage Lorelei arrived, but no one was there to receive them. A wine seller eventually forwarded them to me. 

'…A year ago, I left the Isle to pursue trade. Thanks to your funding, I've established a shop in Eastdale. You're always welcome to vacation here.'

'…Payment for our next transaction remains outstanding. Please note that, starting next month, we will no longer handle live cargo at the abandoned port in Sapphire Isle. Restoration, disguise, and relocation services will also be…'

Were these unclaimed letters truly the end of her story?

No. It couldn't end like this…

characters.name: Jinxed Selena
characters.title: The Penniless Peddler
characters.birthday: The day she was left at the monastery gate.

stories.title: Background
stories.text:
'I am Selena the Deadly Arrow, chief assistant to Silver-haired and first disciple of Lord Van Helsing!'

Following the trail of clues, the sharp and resourceful Selena arrives at Sapphire Isle to begin her perilous covert investigation. If not for her courage and wit, Master Van Helsing would have fallen into enemy hands, imprisoned and tortured. Without her keen eye for detail, Silver-haired would never have uncovered the secrets behind the Mistbound Terror. And without her unerring aim, Bella could not have escaped from Joyce's vile henchmen. Let us all acclaim her name—Selena, the promising candidate for the future Bell Ringer seat!

stories.title: Selena's Ledger I
stories.text:
Someone carelessly left their ledger at the inn. A quick peek now—surely no one will notice:

'It's been a while since I last attended the assassins' gathering. Had to spend a fortune to get information about Master Van Helsing's whereabouts. But why is Brandy, who sold me the information, also here at Sapphire Isle? They even tried to convince me to leave Master Van Helsing's side—was I deceived? Today's debt: 200,000,000 Soli. Master Van Helsing always says that many things are priceless. He'll surely approve of how decisively I spent money where it matters!'

No, I'm quite certain Van Helsing wouldn't approve at all.

stories.title: Selena's Ledger II
stories.text:
Hmm? Who left their ledger here again...

'I can't believe I met Silver-haired, Master Van Helsing's dear friend, here at the bay! Brandy wasn't lying after all! Surely it won't be long before I find Master Van Helsing and come to his rescue in his hour of need! The graceful and beautiful Lorelei even gave me a golden spatula—it must be worth quite a sum! Miss Lorelei is the best! Today's debt: 187,320,000 Soli. Hardworking as I am, I will pay off these debts in no time!'

No amount of hard work could possibly pay off that kind of debt.

stories.title: Selena's Ledger III
stories.text:
Wait a minute, isn't this ledger showing up around me too frequently to be coincidence? Well, let me see what's written inside this time, anyway:

'Lorelei is the Mistbound Terror! That information was well worth the 100 million Soli—I'll never trust people who give me gifts right after meeting them. Rich people are all villains! Still no leads on Master Van Helsing's whereabouts. The only good news is that I accidentally spilled milk on some grilled squid, and it somehow became a popular new dish. Rich people have such strange tastes! Today's debt: 286,145,000 Soli. When will this ever end...'

For someone usually so cautious, it's surprising how easily she was fooled by a pretty lady...

stories.title: Selena's Ledger IV
stories.text:
Left at the inn, this seems to be the final page of her ledger:

'At last, I found Master Van Helsing, and Silver-haired's companion was safely rescued. Everything seems to have reached a perfect conclusion—even my debts have been cleared thanks to someone's help. Bella, whom I just met, gave me a beautiful seashell bracelet right away. She's the second kindest person to me in Sapphire Isle after Silver-haired! Today I've finally paid off all my debts and even have some extra income. But... if I save up another 200 or 300 million Soli, could I help Bella get a new body to stand again? Yet, as Master Van Helsing said, many things are priceless...'

characters.name: Fleeting Bella
characters.title: Twilight's Radiance
characters.birthday: The Annual Fireworks Celebration in Sapphire Isle.

stories.title: Background
stories.text:
'My longing will linger, as fireflies and stars, lighting your way home.'

When her once-familiar homeland changed beyond recognition, and the memories she held faded like fragments of a dream, the Tidewisp in Bella's pocket remained—a quiet reminder that their promise was never an illusion.

If the promise made eleven years ago had yet to be fulfilled, then surely it would be—whether in the year they grew up, the year their names were known, or in some future yet to unfold.

stories.title: The Best Birthday Gift
stories.text:
In Bella's secret treasure spot, there lies an inscribed pearl.

The pearl bears an inscription in human language, stating that Bella and Lorelei are friends for life.

When Lorelei's mother married Uncle Averdin, she received a pearl ring. The priest said that vows spoken over a pearl ring must never be broken.

Bella too made a vow to the pearl. And she will treasure it always.

This is her 'most unique birthday gift.'

stories.title: The Most Colorless Life
stories.text:
In Bella's secret spot, I also found a notebook.

Inside, Bella had documented her studies of the ocean's tidal patterns, the moon's waxing and waning cycles, and the daily routines of life in Sapphire Isle... After uncovering all these patterns, Bella left her own assessment—dull.

It seems she expended every effort to understand this world, determined to uncover all its secrets.

stories.title: The Most Prosaic Script
stories.text:
Yakov told me that to celebrate Bella's recovery, he arranged for her to take part in a new interactive performance by the bay.

Bella, playing the Coffee Bean Princess, delivered such brutally honest commentary about the plot that it completely contradicted her character, yet somehow won unexpected praise from the audience.

Yakov was pleased that the performance had brought a long-absent smile to little Bella's face, but she declared it 'the dullest script' she had ever seen.

stories.title: The Stale and the Splendid
stories.text:
Bella's condition continued to improve, and she sent over a new piece of sheet music. I asked Acappella to perform it, and the music stirred distant yet warm memories. Though I couldn't clearly see their form, I could feel the 'longing' within—it was a song about my homeland.

Bella said it was the most unique song, written just for me. She seems to have an almost obsessive distinction between what is 'dull' and what is 'unique.'

stories.title: The Tidewisp's Promise
stories.text:
Long after that, I received a package from Yakov containing a dried Tidewisp seed.

The note inside stated that when I grow this Tidewisp and it blooms, Bella will send me her next 'most unique' letter.

'And don't forget to prove our promise to the gods.'

characters.name: Genevieve
characters.title: Timeless Firebrand
characters.birthday: The eve before Calamity fractured the world.

stories.title: Background
stories.text:
<style=Highlight>We recommend experiencing the [Love and Lust] story before reading this Vassal Journal.</style>

'Pray that time encroaches no further…'

Among the most perilous inmates confined within Ironfist Gaol, she stands as a high-security threat whose repeated escape attempts have earned her infamy. Whispers speak of shadowy ties binding her to the fallen Carrelle family—exiled to this forsaken place for transgressing some unspeakable taboo. Every word she utters, every gesture she makes, betrays an intimate knowledge of Noah that transcends mere acquaintance, as though she has walked alongside him through countless unspoken chapters. Her relentless determination to orchestrate Noah's escape only deepens the enigma that shrouds her true identity.

stories.title: 'Bishop' I
stories.text:
The world knows the 'Manor of Eternal Flame' as an intricate web of deception spun by Carrelle royalty. Yet only today, inhabiting the knight's form within Genevieve's memories, do I truly witness the genesis of this grand conspiracy.

The princess's day unfolds like an endless battlefield—dawn breaks with equestrian drills, midday is spent on tactical studies, and twilight brings political lessons. Every merciless hour of this regimen serves one sacred purpose: the salvation of Carrelle lands devoured by the flames of war.

In political class, the atmosphere thickens to a suffocating weight as the bishop delivers his calculated torment: 'Your Highness, envision the borders erupting in warfare. Would you levy crushing taxes upon your people to fund our armies, condemning millions to starvation? Or would you empty the royal granaries to feed the masses while watching the Kingdom crumble to ash? As future Lord, what is your choice?'

The realization strikes like lightning—this is Carrelle family's merciless probe of its heir. I surge to my feet, steel singing as my blade finds the bishop's throat, declaring his crimes of 'defiance against the sovereign and sedition among the people.' Death has never touched him so intimately. His face drains to bone-white terror.

'Enough.' Genevieve's touch guides my sword aside with gentle authority, her gaze turning toward the bishop with eyes that dance with dark amusement: 'Sir, the burden you and Father bear is not lost on me. In these precarious times, we all must navigate our own treacherous paths and impossible choices.'

In that crystalline moment, I glimpse the mastermind's satisfaction as she watches her carefully placed pieces align upon the board.

stories.title: 'Rook' I
stories.text:
The Manor of Eternal Flame's magnificence defied every expectation—sprawling training halls, immaculate quarters, trial grounds bristling with weapons of every conceivable design... All of it a testament to the 'glorious future' promised to those desperate souls sold into bondage.

Yet beneath this grandeur, an unrelenting heat pulsed from the manor's depths, a constant reminder that the ever-beating heart lay buried far below.

It was then that understanding dawned: Genevieve had never betrayed her bloodline. When she and countless Brennholts were consumed by fire, their purpose was not to destroy the Divine Body, but to smother the Calamity 'Flames of War'—a karmic fire that burned a thousandfold more fiercely than any earthly flame.

Now, on the eve of the sacrificial rite, I could feel the frenzy and wild vigor of the flames of Calamity with crystalline clarity. The Divine Body was spending its waning energy in desperate struggle, fighting to contain and suppress the very essence of Calamity writhing within its core. What stratagem had Genevieve prepared for this moment?

Firelight flickered across Genevieve's features as she drew an ancient wheel from the folds of her robes. Intricate patterns were carved deep into its bronze surface. If memory served, this was the sacred heirloom passed down through generations of the Alita family.

stories.title: 'Pawn'
stories.text:
In that moment, I could not fathom what method Genevieve would employ to quell the Calamity.

The following dawn brought with it an eerie echo of history—a vast procession of slaves trudging toward the forbidden grounds of the Divine Body, Genevieve walking silently at the rear of the line.

Dread clawed at my chest. I lunged forward, seizing one of the slaves by the shoulder, desperate to warn him—this was no trial leading to liberation, and they were marching to their deaths as sacrificial offerings.

The slave turned slowly, and in his gaze I found not terror, but a resolve unlike anything I had ever witnessed—the transcendent serenity that belongs only to those who embrace their fate willingly. 'I know.' he said simply.

He spoke of his willingness to become a sacrifice, for Princess Genevieve would guide them all to shatter the cursed destiny of the Carrelle family. Not in this age, but in the time yet to come.

At last, comprehension flooded through me. I understood Genevieve's gambit to break the deadlock.

I understood why she had bidden me wait in this place—the 'Queen' would lead all her 'pawns' to flow against the current of a fated future, reshaping the present.

stories.title: Dagger of Anti-Entropy
stories.text:
In Ironfist, Genevieve wore a dagger pinned to her chest. In the final moments of our escape, she handed it to me. Only upon closer inspection did I realize—this dagger was a miniature version of the sword that had been my faithful companion through countless battles across the years.

At that time, I had no idea that within this slender steel lay the fervent prayers of every soul in the Carrelle family, intertwined with the unyielding creed that Genevieve and I had forged—to reverse the Calamity.

characters.name: Valora
characters.title: Steeled Mare
characters.birthday: The day history's greatest knight was dubbed.

stories.title: Background
stories.text:
'To ride into battle, one must have cause. Mine—past, present, and forever—is the same.'

Loyalty courses through the veins of the Aegis bloodline, a creed Valora lives to perfection. As the old master's fiercest knight, she rides alone into battle, raises her Vassals, and secures the family's glory. Though the old master is gone, her devotion remains unbroken. To her, the Bathory legacy is sacred—and only those of the rightful bloodline may carry it forward.

stories.title: Rusty Saddle
stories.text:
A weathered metal saddle acquired from a marketplace vendor, its patches of rust concealing the ancient engravings etched beneath.

The traveling merchant claimed he had discovered it among the ruins of an ancient battlefield near Ganelon territory, hoping to turn a handsome profit from his find.

Clearly, he had no inkling that the heraldic crest bore the marks of both Bathory and Aegis. Had he known, he never would have dared hawk such a relic in broad daylight, lest the Silver Cross come calling in the shadows of night.

Once the truth dawned upon him, terror seized him. He thrust the saddle into my hands for a mere 1 Soli and hastily began gathering his wares.

stories.title: Lost & Found
stories.text:
Bearing this saddle, I made my way back to Bathory Castle.

What forgotten time lay buried beneath that veil of rust? As one who had lost all memory of my own past, I found myself consumed by curiosity.

I talked to both Empousa and Jestel, hoping they might shed light on this mystery.

Empousa declared she knew nothing of its origins, while Jestel revealed that such intricate patterns were exceedingly rare, even within the Aegis family.

Throughout the family's long history, only one ancestor had earned the right to bear such markings—the great Valora Aegis herself.

stories.title: Hollow History
stories.text:
I made arrangements with Valora to collect the saddle.

The Bathory had awakened several elders from the Ancestral Vault, and Valora was among them.

Our previous letter marked my first communication with her. Before our meeting, perhaps I should learn more about her.

From the Cartographer's survey notes, I discovered that she had been gravely wounded in a bitter battle.

Strangely, however, despite her standing as both general and knight of the Bathory, the family's records concerning her remain frustratingly vague. I have combed through every chronicle, yet cannot piece together an idea about her. Even the crucial reason for her slumber remains shrouded in mystery, leaving only the words 'gravely wounded.'

When I asked Cain, he merely smiled and offered nothing.

stories.title: Eternal Stars
stories.text:
At the Observatory, Valora gazed across the entire Bathory territory and recounted the history that Baphomet had erased.

Though I had already read the survey notes, I was still struck with shock by the historical details told firsthand by someone who had lived through them.

'But why arrange to meet at the Observatory?'

Hearing my question, Valora fell into silence for a moment before revealing her reasons.

'In the time I have slumbered, all things in this world have changed beyond recognition. All of this feels foreign to me; only the eternal stars above still whisper of home.'

Before departing the Observatory, I told Valora that I had once asked Cain about her past. She advised me to maintain a certain discipline of caution around Cain.

stories.title: Knightly Code
stories.text:
The more I conversed with Valora, the more I came to admire her.

On the battlefield, she charged alongside Ludgard, facing formidable enemies with unwavering courage.

In the Hall of the Elders, she chose to serve as advisor to the young master, maintaining her unwavering loyalty to the Bathory. Even when her loyalty caused Baphomet's resentment, she never once regretted it.

When friction frequently arose between the Bathory and the Ganelon, she wielded compassion to preserve the fragile peace.

Valora possesses every quality a knight should embody.

Therefore, she deserves the treatment a knight has earned.

characters.name: Sirene
characters.title: Cloak of Shadow
characters.birthday: Eve of Crimson Moon

stories.title: Background
stories.text:
'Scream a little louder, or I'll keep you trapped in my mantle forever.'

For most of the Bloodborn, Sirene's name had long sunk into the depths of forgotten memory, fading with each passing generation.

But the moment the silver-haired sinner stepped through the gates of Bathory Castle, a few idle murmurs from deep within stirred—enough to make her insolent descendants recall the fear etched into their blood.

stories.title: Strange Mantle
stories.text:
Deep in the wardrobe hang twenty-nine identical cloaks.

Yet lately, one of them feels… different. Perhaps it's only my imagination.

No matter how I scour my memory, I cannot recall where this particular cloak came from. Maybe that only proves how utterly unremarkable it is. Or perhaps… it was never mine to begin with. Perhaps someone else placed it there.

No—that's impossible. Isn't it?

stories.title: Eternal Slumber
stories.text:
After exchanging letters with Sirene, strange fragments of memory began to surface.

I saw miracles unfold on an ancient battlefield engulfed in fire and Black Blood. I watched as the crypt's heavy stone gates slammed shut, locking away the Bloodborn's wrath and despair along with a distant hope meant for the far-off future.

The memory ends there, but the feeling of that awakening still lingers in my chest.

What does it all mean...?

stories.title: Hand in Hand in Hand in Hand
stories.text:
Sirene does have more hands than most—likely extensions of her will.

Just as she loathes introducing herself, she hates doing anything with her own hands. Rather than soil her skin with coarse objects or tire her muscles with effort, she'd much rather curl up in her cloak and let its hands do the work.

Come to think of it... how does she control so many at once?

stories.title: Crimson Inquisition
stories.text:
The 'Crimson Inquisition'—that's what the history books call the great battle I glimpsed.

Overwhelmed by the Church's Blood Power, the Bloodborn of that era had no choice but to seal away their Elders—those who carried strange and ancient powers—deep within the crypt.

A mantle, a lance, a warhorse, armor... In the fractured haze of memory, only faint silhouettes remain.

And in a mantle soaked with vengeful souls, I saw Sirene's sleeping face.

Was that the destination she had reserved for me...?

characters.name: Julius
characters.title: The Notched Halberd
characters.birthday: A night with millions of stars.

stories.title: Background
stories.text:
'Be the hunter—or be the prey. There is no third path.'

He is the quiet shadow in the Hall of Elders. The power struggles within the family, the clashes beyond its walls—these are but hollow echoes to him. His heart beats for the battlefield alone. To fight as a group is cowardice; victory requires neither schemes nor strategy. He needs no army, only his halberd and his resolve. Beneath the moonlight, he is the hunter, and his prey can only whisper prayers for mercy.

stories.title: The Shattered Weapon
stories.text:
A painting hangs in the corridor outside the Ancestral Vault, its subject a shattered spear. The canvas is stained with brownish marks, yet it has never been entrusted to skilled artisans for restoration.

When I asked Elder Dalcaro about its origins, she explained that it was created during the bloodiest battle in Bloodborn history, meant to honor Julius, who fell in that conflict. But when I pressed her for more details, she abruptly fell silent, as though bound by an unseen command.

stories.title: A Haunting Dream
stories.text:
On a restless day, I passed the painting again and caught the faintest sound emanating from within.

Was it haunted? A trap? Unease gripped me as I drew closer, the clash of weapons and the scrape of armor resonating through my bones. The echoes swelled, forming vivid visions:

a battlefield cloaked in dust. In my hands, I held a blood-streaked spear. Behind me, the dead lay in countless numbers; before me, enemies surged like a ceaseless tide. A voice, calm yet brimming with fervor, whispered in my ears:

Go and claim our victory.

Was this a dream? Or had Sirene willed me to meet her fallen comrade-in-arms? The truth eluded me.

stories.title: Bizarre Weapon
stories.text:
In that battle, my weapon shattered.

As I faltered, struggling against the tide of enemies, a spear suddenly materialized in my grasp. The moment I laid eyes upon it, I felt its eager anticipation—it yearned to fight alongside me.

Very well, I thought. Let us test your power.

The weapon seemed alive. Its razor-sharp edge tore through throats, its blunt grip crushed skulls, and its arcs were swift and merciless, painting the battlefield in blood. Yet, deep down, I knew—I had never been trained to fight like this.

stories.title: The Blood-Stained Hammer
stories.text:
All the strange occurrences began the moment I touched that painting. Perhaps the answers to this mystery lie there as well.

I scoured every corner for traces of Julius, but my search was fruitless. Only Van Helsing unearthed a tome from the Church's archives—a book titled 'The Blood-Stained Hammer.' Its pages spoke in cryptic tones of a Bathory elder who fell during the Church's crusade against the heretics centuries ago. His spear, the text claimed, shattered in a desperate battle against the Bell Ringer. Afterward, the heretics were utterly defeated, their existence wiped away.

stories.title: Thirst for Blood
stories.text:
I don't know what happened to Julius, who had been corresponding with me. I came to the painting at the entrance of the Ancestral Vault, but it showed no change. I tried speaking to the painting, but it gave no response.

In the many days that followed, I received no more letters from Julius. Yet around the castle, rumors began to spread—rumors of a spear that kills. Could this strange and ominous tale be tied to Julius's sudden disappearance?

stories.title: Brutal Ritual
stories.text:
As a reward for my long-standing patronage of the Puppet Association, Elder Bella unexpectedly and graciously shared a piece of intelligence with me.

Legend tells of an ancient ritual so abhorrent that even the Bloodborn, deemed it too brutal. This ritual demands a cursed spear, its blade soaked with the blood of 999 innocent souls, and the purest 'holy light'—a virtuous person of unshakable ideals. Through unspeakable torments, the ritual imprisons this person in a purgatory of agony, despair, and suffering. Their radiance is defiled, their ideals shattered, and their hope twisted into a cruel illusion. In the end, they are transformed into a mindless weapon, a 'weapon spirit' of unparalleled power.

characters.name: Seraphina
characters.title: Wings of War
characters.birthday: When wings ascend at dawn's rise.

stories.title: Background
stories.text:
'When you lose, just lie still—there's no shame in it.'

As a weapon of the Church, Seraphina has undergone countless alterations, and that exceptional Silver Blood Ritual scoured away nearly all trace of her humanity.

Though she is ranked third in the Silver Cross, she remains dissatisfied with her rank. Even she cannot explain the origin of her relentless fixation on becoming the strongest, nor discern where such hunger will one day lead her.

stories.title: The Forged Blade
stories.text:
As a living weapon forged through the Church's most advanced designs, Seraphina's prowess in battle is second to none. Yet within the Silver Cross, her lone-wolf temperament and disruptive methods make her a perpetual thorn in others' side.

Where others long for reliable allies, Seraphina hungers only for formidable foes.

stories.title: Resolve
stories.text:
Seraphina's origins remain a mystery.

From what little I uncovered, she was taken in by the Church as a child and shaped into a blade from her earliest days. The body given by her birth parents has long since been transformed through countless modifications into a mere instrument of slaughter.

For such a tool, ruin is not a possibility but an expectation, etched into its very being.

Thus, Seraphina's resolve to meet her end in battle cannot be measured by ordinary human thought.

stories.title: Shattered Wings
stories.text:
In a sense, Seraphina has embraced humanity's eternal dream of flight—though the price has been grievous.

Whether it be the ruinous toll the ritual and modification have taken upon her lifespan, or the perilous combat missions she accepts, both stand as certain omens that her life will know no peaceful end.

Every bird is fated to fall.

If ruin is her destined end, then perhaps she yearns for that last battle—the one that will strip away all she has ever loved.

Perhaps I am beginning to truly grasp her hunger for victory, vast enough to eclipse all else...

characters.name: Letitia
characters.title: Wind's Caress
characters.birthday: When daybreak is shrouded by the tempest.

stories.title: Background
stories.text:
'Life and hope are the most precious things in the world.'

The exact moment Letitia's consciousness first stirred remains lost in time. Perhaps she walked this realm from the primordial ages, when molten rock had yet to cool into the foundations of the earth.

Yet the Letitia of today bears little resemblance to the ancient force one might expect.

To those who know her, she appears as nothing more—and nothing less—than a soul of boundless gentleness and compassion.

All of this, it seems, traces back to a single, fateful 'seal'...

'Life and hope are the most precious things in the world.'

stories.title: Greetings, Human
stories.text:
When speaking of Letitia's gentleness and kindness, one cannot ignore her initiative in reaching out to human society.

From Letitia's perspective, human civilization emerged in what seemed but an 'instant.' Yet these spirited little beings brought change to the world, which, however small, was something that had never existed before.

Thus, Letitia began to mirror their form and behavior, quickly becoming entranced in doing so.

In her own words:
'Only through humanity can the stories of the natural world be told.'

stories.title: The Malice Within
stories.text:
For Letitia, frequent contact with humanity proved a double-edged blessing.

Just as nature encompasses gentle breezes and soft rains, so too does it encompass raging torrents and towering waves; even the most virtuous souls harbor shadows within their hearts.

In time, 'things that had never existed before' began to stir within Letitia.

Anger, jealousy, greed... These dark aspects of human nature gradually seeped into Letitia's heart, filling her with unspeakable dread.

At last, she resolved to seal away 'that version of herself' forever.

stories.title: Ancient Seal
stories.text:
I have gazed upon the stone door that binds Letitia's dark nature, and I have tasted the suffocating dread that heralds a Tempest. I know with absolute certainty that Letitia's choice was the only path.

Yet, having severed all negative emotions, Letitia's boundless compassion invariably became her greatest burden, blinding her to harsh truths in moments when decisive action was required.

Perhaps the dark side of human nature serves a purpose more vital than we dare admit.

stories.title: Heart of the Gale
stories.text:
The wind-born treasure that harbors the fury of storms—known as Zephyr.

Whether across mountains or through valleys, within emerald forests or golden grain fields, wherever life takes root, infinite possibilities unfold.

And when all living beings yearn for the blessing of sweet rain, the name they whisper in reverence is none other than Letitia's.

At the dawn of time, I shared a fleeting moment with Letitia.

Then, neither of us could foresee what future the Zephyr she bore would bring forth, but now, all has been revealed.

characters.name: Alexi
characters.title: White Midnight
characters.birthday: When time reaches its end.

stories.title: Background
stories.text:
'Guide at the end of time, leading the stars back to harbor.'

Even as a created being, Alexi holds emotions both deep and overflowing with sincerity. She loves Livian dearly and entrusts all her faith and longing to the legendary Hero destined to set the Ark in motion.

Waiting had always ended in disappointment; every spark of hope flared only to fade. So when the Hero crossed the boundary of time, shattered her endless solitude, and appeared before Alexi, she felt—for the first time—the joy of a wish fulfilled. Though Noah bears little resemblance to the legend, to her, that difference itself is what gives him his singular allure—the very essence of what makes him the Hero.

stories.title: Romance Novel
stories.text:
Maybe because there isn't much to do aboard the Ark, Alexi's become rather addicted to reading—especially romance novels. More than once when I went looking for her, I found her completely absorbed in some tragic love story about the 'Bloodborn.'

Even this time when we got separated, it was because she wanted to dash off and grab the latest release from the Prophet Cat, Temptation: A Heartless Love Story in the Bloodborn Castle.

I wonder if she ever managed to get her hands on that book...

stories.title: A Secret About Me
stories.text:
What could it be that Alexi never told me? I don't mean to pry into her privacy, but I can't help feeling curious... a secret involving me, perhaps?

Whoever came up with this Task must know both Alexi and me—and with that peculiar tone, I have a pretty good idea whose prank this is.

stories.title: Lingering Warmth
stories.text:
Looking back, there were a few times I woke to find the space beside me still warm. At the time, I thought I'd just shifted in my sleep, but now I realize Alexi must have been lying next to me.

She left no trace except her lingering warmth... truly, a most dutiful 'pillow.'

stories.title: Amulet
stories.text: A gift from Alexi—an amulet said to be imbued with 'mysterious magic.' Those who wear it are blessed by the gods and become favored by fortune, so Alexi told me to keep it with me at all times.

characters.name: Livian
characters.title: Fortune's Fantasy
characters.birthday: When time reaches its end.

stories.title: Background
stories.text:
'The dream I wove became my own cage... locking me away from the world outside.'

She knew emotions were forbidden luxuries—for a beacon forged with purpose, finding the exit at time's end was her only task. She knew false dreams were perilous sanctuaries—for a being blessed with absolute reason, observing the ebb and flow of time and space was her sole mission.

Yet within her perfect logic, she grasped an unshakable truth: no one could halt the decay of time. Fear took root, and she began to retreat—soothing her despair with the tale of the 'Hero,' freeing her true self within empty fantasies.

When the ark at last broke free from its dream-forged chains, ready to sail toward unknown coordinates in time and space, only Livian turned her gaze toward that 'captain' from distant shores:

'This time, it's my turn to wake up.'

stories.title: Born from Nothing
stories.text:
The Joyces once told me that my sister and I were created for a single purpose—to find a way beyond the end of time. We were 'compasses,' we were 'beacons,' but we were never ourselves.

When my sister was born, she was given too much emotion. Instead of joining their research, she preferred curling up beside the Joyces to listen to their stories. To escape the coming collapse of time, they created me—a more rational version of her. But back then, I didn't understand. Could someone like me really be called a living being?

stories.title: Lost to Reason
stories.text:
I find myself sinking deeper into the 'dream.'

Oblivion draws ever closer, and no matter how feverishly I research, I always reach the same crushing conclusion: no one can escape, and no one will survive. The rationality Joyce and the others granted me has become the thorns that pierce my heart—it is reason that demands I find a way beyond Oblivion, yet it is also reason that whispers in my ear: 'None of this has meaning.'

Only within the 'dream' can I escape those relentless voices. Though it is nothing but emptiness, deep within that void I find a peace unlike any other. Yes... If we cannot escape the oblivion, then why not simply wait for the end to come quietly?

stories.title: Born from Whispers
stories.text:
Noah Nevernight.

The name isn't unfamiliar to me. During our observations of time's flow, the Joyces have 'witnessed' this extraordinary being more than once. At first, I paid it little mind. But then I saw him—defying the constraints of time and death again and again, weaving miracles within that dying world. Could he be the 'hero' from my sister's beloved tale? All I know is that my once-quiet heart has begun to beat to a rhythm I've never felt before...

stories.title: Reborn in Dreams
stories.text:
I began experimenting with the 'dream.' I conjured castles surrounded by forests, breathed life into monsters and the demon lord who ruled them, and finally shaped the villagers and treasures from old adventure tales.

—But it still wasn't enough. I had to find a way to weave myself into that tapestry as well.

'Livian, isn't this outfit a bit... over the top?' I can still recall the shy look on my sister's face when she first saw me dressed like that.

'But deep down, isn't this who we truly are? To cast off every restraint and burden, to forget every mission and task, and to live as we've always wished to be.'

stories.title: Awakening at the End
stories.text:
The moment I awoke from the 'dream,' I understood the treacherous path my former self had walked—the road of hesitation and denial.

I am cursed, born at time's twilight, facing a world already bound for oblivion. My fate was destruction from the very start. Yet I am also blessed, for Joyce and the others gifted me with imagination, and my sister filled that imagination with color. From beginning to end, those who could help me have always been by my side.

What I needed was never a 'hero' to deliver salvation, but the courage to open my eyes. Fantasy offered sweet escape, yet only deepened my solitude; reality brings pain, but it also lets me feel the true weight of my soul—and that is the 'self' I have been searching for all along.

characters.name: Ethereal Joan
characters.title: Mind's Salvation
characters.birthday: The day green's final breath yielded to the yellow sands.

stories.title: Background
stories.text:
'Sometimes, laying down one's weapon holds more meaning than continuing to fight.'

Just like a creature driven by instinct, she never understood the reason for her battles.

As a slave, she wielded her weapon solely to claim Victory in the duel; as a commander, she raised her hands solely to break the oppression of the nobles; as a Bell Ringer, she thrust her lance solely to fulfill the mission of the Church.

Only when her strength failed and she could no longer lift her arms did the words of those once beside her bring an awakening—perhaps those gazes fixed upon her, and those heavy expectations, were the very reason she marched forward.

'My vision was always focused on the path ahead, yet I forgot the brilliance of the night sky, the blooming of every star.'

stories.title: Slave of the Desert
stories.text:
No one could have imagined that the kingdom buried beneath the dunes would turn itself into a ceaseless engine of war.

Nor could anyone have foreseen how swiftly such a nation—once teeming with warriors—would fall into ruin within a few short decades.

For as long as Joan could remember, fear ruled every corner of that sand-scarred realm. Under the nobles' reign, food dwindled, water ran dry, and the choking dust drove people into mud-walled shelters. Her role was merely to entertain her masters in deadly duels—purchasing each fragile day of life with one hard-won victory.

Her future had been written by the nobles long before she ever lifted a weapon.

stories.title: Slave of Battle
stories.text:
'We go to war.'

It was the first time Joan answered the hopeful gazes of the other slaves. Those who once cowered beside her in the prison cell no longer bore that same lost, uncertain look.

She could not understand how they—armed only with sticks and stones—could ever hope to bring down foes clad in steel and shield. Yet she tightened her grip upon her weapon all the same.

Battle was instinct. Instinct required no hesitation. And so she marched, step after step, toward the nobles' cities…

stories.title: Slave of War
stories.text:
Blood ran into her eyes, tinting the world a violent red.

Her companions fell one after another, but even as their bodies broke, hoarse cries tore from their throats and their crude clubs rose again and again.

Until a voice reached her—

Like a sandstorm pounding through her chest, like a war-cry thundering against her ear.

Lightning split the heavens and struck her where she stood. Yet no pain followed—only the sensation of her wounds knitting together.

Thunder became her voice. Lightning, her sight. The storm, her strength.

'Fight on—until nothing within you can move again.'

stories.title: Slave of Power
stories.text:
When the final banner of the nobility burned to ash upon the scorched earth, she stood atop the city she had won with her own hands. Below her, the freed slaves cheered. In her grip, the lance of victory gleamed, yet her heart felt hollow, emptied by triumph.

She continued to fight—sweeping aside the nobles’ remaining rebels, driving back Black Blood beasts along the borders.

But beneath the deep night sky, none saw the way she stared down at her own hands.

Hands that summoned thunder and lightning… Yet trembled beneath the weight of a single cup of celebratory wine.

The instinct for battle still howled through her blood, but for the first time, an echo rose to meet it:

'When the battle ends… how is a warrior meant to live?'

Thunder offered no answer. Only the desert remained—its ceaseless winds gnawing day and night at her hollow victory.

stories.title: Shackles of Freedom
stories.text:
Her title as Bell Ringer offered no clarity, and the Silver Blood's memories did nothing to dispel the fog. Still she searched for the meaning of battle— Until the Silver Blood ran dry, and her strength faded into silence.

She recalled the arena now swallowed by ruin: weathered stone walls etched faintly with the scars of past war.

She heard the shouts of the slaves who had once fought at her back. In that distant uproar, the warmth of expectation still lingered.

With her power gone, she heard her own heartbeat for the first time. No thunder. No lightning. Only memories seeping in like gentle rain.

'So that's how it is.'

When she raised her lance once more, the scattered lightning began to surge anew. No longer swayed by the roar of fate, she felt instead the breath of countless comrades resonating with her own.

Her lance had never been hers alone.

stories.title: Background
stories.text:
'The moon is but a dream of the sun, and thus we were forgotten by the light.'
